title: Rental Car App
excerpt: A car rental application where car owners can create their stores, add cars, and allow users to search, book, and contact owners for more information.
overview: Rental Car App is a car rental platform where car owners can create their own stores and add cars for rent. Users can browse rental agencies by store, contact owners for details, and request car reservations. The app provides a filtering system to search for vehicles based on various criteria. It is developed with NestJS for the backend, React Native with Expo for the frontend, PostgreSQL as the database, Firebase for notifications, and WebSocket for real-time messaging.
features: Car owners can create stores and add rental cars.
Users can browse agencies by store.
Contact car owners for more details.
Request car reservations directly through the app.
Advanced search and filtering system for finding cars.
Real-time messaging with WebSocket.
Push notifications using Firebase.

title: FitNest App
excerpt: A mobile application for discovering, joining, and organizing sports events, integrating geolocation, health tracking, and social interactions.
overview: FitNest App is a sports and wellness application designed to help users find and participate in sports events based on their location and preferences. Users can create personalized profiles, join local sports groups, and receive recommendations for nearby events using advanced geolocation with PostGIS. The app also offers a personal dashboard, health tracking features (sleep, nutrition, and stress monitoring), and social interactions, enabling users to share their experiences. The platform is built with a Spring Boot backend, a Flutter frontend, and real-time data analytics tools.
features: Search and participate in sports events based on location and preferences.
User profile creation and customization.
Advanced geolocation and tracking system using PostGIS for event recommendations.
Personal dashboard with event history and tailored recommendations.
Health and wellness tracking: sleep, nutrition, and stress monitoring with personalized suggestions.
Create and manage sports events.
Social interactions: create local sports groups and share experiences.

title: E-commerce Site
excerpt: A web-based e-commerce application developed using Java EE, enabling product inventory and order management.
overview: This project is a web-based e-commerce application developed using Java EE, Servlets, and JSP. It allows merchants to efficiently manage their product inventory and enables customers to place orders online. The system includes stock management features for adding, modifying, and deleting products, as well as an order management system with a shopping cart and order validation.
features: Inventory management: add, modify, and delete products.
Product listing and search by name or category.
Add products to the shopping cart with quantity adjustment.
Order placement and validation with customer details.
Order summary displaying purchased items and total cost.
User-friendly and responsive interface.

team.name: Maryem Minouari
team.role: Software Engineering Student at FST Mohammedia - UH2C

title: Centralization and Classification of Chicago City Traffic
excerpt: Web portal for analyzing and visualizing traffic centrality in Chicago, developed during Object/IoT Technologies workshop.
overview:
The Centralization and Classification of Chicago City Traffic is a web-based portal built as part of the Object/IoT Technologies workshop. This project offers dynamic traffic analysis by leveraging modern mapping tools and clustering algorithms to visualize traffic flows in Chicago City. Users can explore traffic data through interactive maps, filter it by time slots, and uncover critical insights about central traffic patterns.

The system makes use of AGNES clustering to classify traffic flows efficiently, along with Leaflet.js to visualize it through interactive maps. Its responsive design ensures accessibility across devices, delivering a seamless experience for global users with multi-language support.
features: Interactive Map Visualization: Users can zoom and pan through traffic maps for a detailed view of NYC traffic patterns.
Advanced Data Filters: Filter traffic data by year, month, day, and time slots to explore trends across different timeframes.
Color-Coded Clusters: Traffic clusters are visually represented using color codes to highlight areas of congestion or smooth traffic.
Real-Time Traffic Flow Insights: Clickable map markers reveal detailed traffic information and central points.

title: Busway Ticket Chatbot
excerpt: Innovative web app for seamless busway ticket reservations, using Neo4j to manage complex data relationships.
overview:
The Busway Ticket Chatbot is a cutting-edge web application developed as part of the Object Technology/IoT Workshop. It simplifies busway ticket reservations by leveraging a Neo4j graph database to efficiently manage complex data relationships, such as bus schedules, stations, and drivers. This project enhances the user experience by incorporating an AIML-powered chatbot, enabling a conversational interface for booking tickets and obtaining travel information.

The goal was to build a system that offers users a seamless, intuitive, and engaging booking experience while maintaining sophisticated backend data management. The chatbot interacts with users conversationally, transforming the traditional booking process into an easy, interactive journey.
features: Trip Visualization: Users can explore available trips with detailed route information, including departure and arrival times.
Online Reservation System: Provides a hassle-free online ticket booking experience, available 24/7.
Dynamic Data Management with Neo4j: The system utilizes Neo4j to manage relationships between buses, drivers, and stations, ensuring accurate data and real-time updates.
AIML-Powered Chatbot: The chatbot offers a conversational interface, making ticket booking more engaging and personal.

title: Interface Builder
excerpt: A desktop application for creating graphical user interfaces using GTK+ and generating XML-based layouts with FXML.
overview: Interface Builder is a desktop application that enables users to design graphical user interfaces by adding, modifying, and organizing widgets such as buttons, input fields, and containers. The designed UI is structured hierarchically in an XML file while maintaining parent-child relationships. Users can visualize the interface, save the generated XML file, and open existing files for further modifications. The application is built with C and GTK+ for GUI rendering, using FXML for layout definition.
features: Add widgets (buttons, inputs, containers, etc.) to the interface.
Modify widget properties such as size, position, and style.
Display and manage the hierarchy of UI components.
Real-time visualization of the designed interface.
Save the interface layout as an XML file.
Open and edit existing XML files to modify or add new widgets.

title: Rental Car Management App
excerpt: A rental car management application developed using Java and Swing.
overview: This project is a car rental management application developed in Java and Swing. It enables the management of available vehicles, customers, and their reservations.

Remove vehicles from the fleet.

Search for available vehicles based on criteria (brand, price, production date).
Process vehicle returns after the rental period.

title: Sudoku Game
excerpt: A Sudoku-solving application developed in C++ with GTK+, featuring random grid generation and interactive assistance.
overview: Sudoku Game is a Sudoku-solving application developed in C++ using the GTK+ graphical interface toolkit. It allows users to play randomly generated Sudoku grids and includes various features to enhance the user experience. The application offers multiple difficulty levels, interactive hints, and the ability to save progress.
features: Three difficulty levels: Easy, Medium, Hard.
Random Sudoku grid generation.
Save and load game progress.
Hint feature to assist players.
Automatic grid solving for verification.
User-friendly interface with interactive support.

overview: Developed a desktop Tic-Tac-Toe game using Java and JavaFX, implementing the Minimax algorithm for AI decision-making and ensuring an engaging user experience.
features: Classic Tic-Tac-Toe gameplay with a modern graphical user interface.
